page.title: 09Chertsey Abbey, Abbey Fields
page.content: Abbey Fields were once the gardens of Chertsey Abbey, but now they are used for football, dog walking and a children's playground. Every year, Black Cherry Fair takes place on the Fields during July, and includes stalls, arcades, displays and competitions. Also on this site is Abbey House, which is now run as a Day Centre for the elderly of the Chertsey area. There are 2 fish ponds still to be found on the Fields - these are the remnants of the original 7 such ponds. The Abbey ruins are hardly visible, the stones being taken away at the time of the Dissolution of the monastries. Abbey Barn is used for children's theatre, and Abbey Farm is now an animal sanctuary - one 'resident' is a three-legged goat.
